page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: This is an almost no-existent factor in village life. With the closure of the railway staion at Thursford, the village was reduced to one bus a week to Fakenham Market each Thursday. This year the service has been privatised and there is also an Age Concern bus for the elderly each Tuesday, and Wells Community bus to Holt each Friday morning. Secondary schoolchildren travel by hired coach to Wells each day. Most households need one and often two cars to take members of the family to work. A mobile library service travels from Wells to the village once a month. Private coaches are hired by various groups to make summer excursions to the seaside, or evening trips to the theatre in Norwich.
